channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16303] FilterList with MUST_PASS_ONE optimization
item.description:
This JIRA was created to add @Test tag for all the filter related tests. After doing that one such test failed in TestFilterList#testFilterListTwoFiltersMustPassOne.
The test assumes that when a PrefixFilter is added to a filterlist once the given prefix is passed we should SKIP all other rows. But the impl in FilterList for MUST_PASS_ONE filter is such that once the filter in the list sees that filterAllRemaining is true we don't use that to decide if to to SEE_NEXT_USING_HINT or not. This patch tries to handle that case where if for a filter FilterAllRemaining is true then SEEK_NEXT_USING_HINT need not be done.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Adding @Test tag for all the missing test cases fails one of the test cases in FilterList. Will look into it.
Adding @Test tag for all the missing test cases fails one of the test cases in FilterList. Will look into it.
This solves a bug in FilterList when used with PRefix Filter with MUST_PASS_ONE option. Probably a perf fix too. Will change the heading of this JIRA so that it gets more focus.

-1 overall

For other branches adding the @Test to test case will fail the test cases. So do we need the fix in other branches also?
Nick Dimiduk, Sean Busbey,Andrew Purtell
The fix as such may not cause a wrong result when PrefixFiter is used with a filterlist but may cause unnecessary results to be retrieved. I have not verified this with a cluster but can see from what the test expects and what the code does.

I had to revert the addendum from branch-1.3 because it broke compilation. I left the base patch in place, because TestFilter and TestFilterList passed without the addendum. Please verify that things are fine on branch-1.3 and then re-close.

ramkrishna vasudevan, please check compilation before committing. This is the most basic of checks a committer can do. It shouldn't be necessary to ask!

please check compilation before committing. This is the most basic of checks a committer can do. It shouldn't be necessary to ask!

Sorry about this. I should not have done that. Will see to that I compile the code before committing. I expected this bug to be in latest branch-1. And hence in branch-1.3 also. My bad. The addendum was not necessary there only the patch would have been enough.
Thanks Sean Busbey - And sorry for the trouble.
I am not marking this JIRA for 1.3.0 because it means we only have @Test tag added to the tests.
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan I'm going to actually marked the fix Version as 1.3.0 as the commit did went in, and the git history and jira states shall remain in sync
